attributes.action: PLEASE reverse the CO-PROXAMOL prescribing ban due to come into effect in December 2007 and instead make it controlled drug under Schedule 3 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1971, before it is too late and it all becomes a shambles.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Dr. Howard Stoate (MP Dartford) speaking in a House of Commons debate last May, according to  the Hansard report, suggested co-proxamol should become a controlled painkiller as the GP would then be free to prescribe it without having to walk a legal tightrope to do so. Few GPs, if any, will wish to expose themselves to the possible threat of litigation by doing so, however strong the patient’s need for the drug. In practice, the solution amounts to a comprehensive ban he said.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
